original_sap_section_used.ends_at: 10.3. Vital Signs, Weight and Body Surface Area

evaluation_table.original_sap_text: Actual result and change from baseline of all numeric laboratory parameters including clinical chemistry, hematology, numeric urinalysis and coagulation will be summarized using descriptive statistics
evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: Clinical laboratory assessments include hematology, clinical chemistry, urinalysis, and coagulation.
evaluation_table.protocol_text: Clinical laboratory tests: hematology, clinical chemistry, urinalysis
evaluation_table.reasoning: Both documents list the same high-level categories.

evaluation_table.original_sap_text: Clinical laboratory test samples will be analyzed at the local laboratory.
evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: Laboratory samples will be collected according to the Schedule of Assessments (Section 11.1).
evaluation_table.protocol_text: Clinical laboratory tests... will be performed within 3 days prior to Day 1 of each cycle.
evaluation_table.reasoning: Standard reference to schedule.

evaluation_table.original_sap_text: Clinical laboratory test samples will be analyzed at the local laboratory. Reported units and normal ranges are various among sites. Reported units will be converted to standard units, if applicable.
evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: Clinical laboratory test samples will be analyzed at the local laboratory for routine monitoring; however, data will be standardized to International System (SI) units for reporting and analysis.
evaluation_table.protocol_text: Clinical laboratory test samples will be analyzed at the local laboratory.
evaluation_table.reasoning: Both specify local laboratory analysis and unit standardization.

evaluation_table.original_sap_text: Actual result and change from baseline of all numeric laboratory parameters including... hematology... will be summarized
evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: Hematology: Hematocrit, hemoglobin, white blood cell count, absolute neutrophil count (ANC), and platelets.
evaluation_table.protocol_text: Hematology: hematocrit, hemoglobin, white blood cell count, absolute neutrophil count and platelets
evaluation_table.reasoning: Generated SAP lists specific parameters which match the Protocol. Original SAP refers to categories generally.

evaluation_table.original_sap_text: Actual result and change from baseline of all numeric laboratory parameters including clinical chemistry... will be summarized
evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: Clinical Chemistry: Albumin, alkaline phosphatase (ALP), alanine aminotransferase (ALT), aspartate aminotransferase (AST), blood urea nitrogen (BUN), calcium, chloride, creatine phosphokinase (CPK), creatine kinase-myocardial band (CK-MB) isoenzyme, total cholesterol, creatinine, creatinine clearance (CrCl) (estimated by Cockcroft-Gault formula, see Section 11.6), gamma-glutamyl transferase (GGT), glucose, lactate dehydrogenase (LDH), triglyceride, high-density lipoprotein (HDL) cholesterol, phosphate, potassium, sodium, total bilirubin, direct bilirubin, total protein, and uric acid.
evaluation_table.protocol_text: Clinical chemistry: albumin, alkaline phosphatase... [list matches Generated SAP]
evaluation_table.reasoning: Generated SAP lists specific parameters which match the Protocol. Original SAP refers to categories generally.

evaluation_table.original_sap_text: Actual result and change from baseline of all numeric laboratory parameters including... numeric urinalysis... will be summarized... The results for all non-numeric urinalysis parameters... will be categorized into normal and abnormal
evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: Urinalysis: Bilirubin, blood, glucose, ketones, leukocytes, nitrite, pH, protein, specific gravity, and urobilinogen via dipstick.
evaluation_table.protocol_text: Urinalysis: bilirubin, blood, glucose... [list matches Generated SAP]
evaluation_table.reasoning: Generated SAP lists specific parameters which match the Protocol.

evaluation_table.original_sap_text: The results for all non-numeric urinalysis parameters including microscopic urinalysis collected as qualitative format will be categorized into normal and abnormal
evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: Microscopic examination and 24-hour urine collection (for protein) will be performed if indicated.
evaluation_table.protocol_text: microscopic examination... 24 hour urine collection if indicated at Screening
evaluation_table.reasoning: Consistent with Original SAP and Protocol.

evaluation_table.original_sap_text: Actual result and change from baseline of all numeric laboratory parameters including... coagulation will be summarized
evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: Coagulation: Prothrombin time (PT) and prothrombin time international normalized ratio (INR) (for patients receiving aspirin).
evaluation_table.protocol_text: Coagulation: ... prothrombin time and prothrombin time international normalized ratio tests
evaluation_table.reasoning: Generated SAP lists specific parameters which match the Protocol.

evaluation_table.original_sap_text: The baseline value for all analyses will be the last non-missing value prior to the first infusion unless otherwise specified.
evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: Baseline is defined in Section 4.2.
evaluation_table.reasoning: Cross-reference to general baseline definition is acceptable.

evaluation_table.original_sap_text: If visit names are ‘Unscheduled’ or ‘EOT’, the post-baseline result of laboratory data will be presented by period, defined as follows... [detailed logic for Induction, Maintenance, Follow-Up]
evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: Post-baseline summaries will include all scheduled visits during the Induction Study Period (Cycles 1 through 6), Maintenance Study Period (Cycles 1 and every 3 cycles thereafter), and the End of Treatment (EOT) visit.
evaluation_table.omitted_content: Detailed logic for assigning EOT and unscheduled visits to specific study periods based on dates relative to infusion.
evaluation_table.reasoning: Generated SAP omits the specific logic found in the Original SAP for assigning data to study periods, which is important for a study with distinct phases.

evaluation_table.original_sap_text: Clinical chemistry, hematology, urinalysis and coagulation data will be presented in separate listings
evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: All laboratory data will be included in the data listings.
evaluation_table.reasoning: Both require listings for all data.

evaluation_table.original_sap_text: Actual result and change from baseline of all numeric laboratory parameters including clinical chemistry, hematology... will be summarized using descriptive statistics
evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: Summaries of actual values and change from baseline will be provided for hematology and clinical chemistry.
evaluation_table.reasoning: Matches Original SAP for these categories.

evaluation_table.original_sap_text: Actual result and change from baseline of all numeric laboratory parameters including... numeric urinalysis and coagulation will be summarized using descriptive statistics
evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: Coagulation and urinalysis results will be presented in data listings only.
evaluation_table.omitted_content: Descriptive statistics for coagulation and numeric urinalysis.
evaluation_table.reasoning: Original SAP requires descriptive summaries for coagulation and numeric urinalysis; Generated SAP explicitly restricts them to listings only.

evaluation_table.original_sap_text: Actual result and change from baseline... will be summarized using descriptive statistics by treatment group, laboratory category, test parameter and visit.
evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: Laboratory parameters will be summarized by treatment group and visit using descriptive statistics.
evaluation_table.reasoning: Standard descriptive statistics methodology.

evaluation_table.original_sap_text: Actual result and change from baseline... will be summarized
evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: Summaries will include both actual values and change from baseline values.
evaluation_table.reasoning: Matches Original SAP.

evaluation_table.original_sap_text: Actual result and change from baseline... will be summarized... by... visit
evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: As established in Section 4.5, nominal visits will be used for these summaries.
evaluation_table.reasoning: Consistent with Original SAP's visit-based summary approach.

evaluation_table.original_sap_text: Only the most severe case during unscheduled and scheduled visits will be included for the post-baseline result in the shift table. [Implies by-visit summaries are scheduled only]
evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: Only scheduled visits will be included in by-visit summaries.
evaluation_table.reasoning: Consistent with standard practice and Original SAP's handling of unscheduled visits.

evaluation_table.original_sap_text: Clinical laboratory parameters... will be labeled with a CTCAE term and grading will be applied... according to CTCAE version 5.0.
evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: Laboratory abnormalities will be graded according to the National Cancer Institute (NCI) Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events (CTCAE) version 5.0, where applicable.
evaluation_table.protocol_text: Adverse events will be reported for term and grade according to the Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events (CTCAE) v.5.0.
evaluation_table.reasoning: Matches Original SAP and Protocol.

evaluation_table.original_sap_text: A shift table will be also produced... Only the most severe case during unscheduled and scheduled visits will be included for the post-baseline result in the shift table.
evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: Shift tables will be used to summarize the number and percentage of patients by baseline category (Grade 0 through 4) versus the worst post-baseline category.
evaluation_table.reasoning: Matches Original SAP's requirement for shift tables using worst/most severe post-baseline value.

evaluation_table.original_sap_text: Only the most severe case during unscheduled and scheduled visits will be included for the post-baseline result in the shift table.
evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: Worst post-baseline value is defined as the most extreme CTCAE grade observed during the Whole Study Period (as defined in Section 4.2), including results from unscheduled assessments.
evaluation_table.reasoning: Matches Original SAP.

evaluation_table.original_sap_text: The results for all non-numeric urinalysis parameters... will be categorized into normal and abnormal... and will be summarized in a shift table.
evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: For parameters not covered by CTCAE grading, shift tables will cross-classify patients by baseline category (Low, Normal, High) relative to the laboratory reference range versus the worst post-baseline category.
evaluation_table.reasoning: Generated SAP generalizes the shift table requirement to all non-graded parameters (L/N/H), which covers the intent of the Original SAP.

evaluation_table.original_sap_text: null
evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: Analyses will be performed separately for the "High" and "Low" directions when both are clinically relevant (e.g., potassium).
evaluation_table.reasoning: Extra detail consistent with standard practice.

evaluation_table.original_sap_text: The number and percentage of patients with a result for each grade will be summarized by laboratory category, CTCAE term, visit and CTCAE grade.
evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: The number and percentage of patients with treatment-emergent laboratory abnormalities (defined as an increase in CTCAE grade from baseline) will be summarized by treatment group.
evaluation_table.reasoning: Generated SAP specifies 'treatment-emergent' (increase from baseline) while Original SAP asks for summaries by grade. These are compatible safety summaries.

evaluation_table.original_sap_text: null
evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: Particular focus will be placed on Grade 3 or 4 abnormalities.
evaluation_table.reasoning: Standard safety focus.

evaluation_table.original_sap_text: Only the most severe case during unscheduled and scheduled visits will be included for the post-baseline result in the shift table.
evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: Unscheduled laboratory assessments will be excluded from by-visit summaries but will be included in the determination of the worst post-baseline values and in all listings.
evaluation_table.reasoning: Matches Original SAP.

evaluation_table.original_sap_text: null
evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: If multiple laboratory values are collected on the same study day, the value collected closest to the scheduled assessment time will be used for by-visit summaries.
evaluation_table.reasoning: Standard data handling rule.

evaluation_table.original_sap_text: Only the most severe case during unscheduled and scheduled visits will be included for the post-baseline result in the shift table.
evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: For the determination of the worst post-baseline value, the most extreme value among all results (scheduled or unscheduled) for that day will be used.
evaluation_table.reasoning: Matches Original SAP.

missing_from_generated_sap.original_sap_text: If visit names are ‘Unscheduled’ or ‘EOT’, the post-baseline result of laboratory data will be presented by period, defined as follows... [detailed logic for Induction, Maintenance, Follow-Up]
missing_from_generated_sap.description: Detailed logic for assigning EOT and unscheduled visits to specific study periods based on dates relative to infusion.
missing_from_generated_sap.reasoning: Original SAP provides complex logic for assigning data to study periods. Generated SAP omits this logic, which is a missing specification.

missing_from_generated_sap.original_sap_text: Grades that require clinical input only will not be assigned to these parameters. Grades which are part numeric and part clinical input will be assigned based on the numeric portion only.
missing_from_generated_sap.description: Specific rule about handling CTCAE grades requiring clinical input.
missing_from_generated_sap.reasoning: Specific grading rule missing from Generated SAP.

missing_from_generated_sap.original_sap_text: The CTCAE Grade 5 (Death) will not be applied in this analysis since death cannot be determined from a laboratory result.
missing_from_generated_sap.description: Explicit exclusion of Grade 5 from laboratory grading.
missing_from_generated_sap.reasoning: Specific exclusion rule missing from Generated SAP.

issues.original_sap_text: Actual result and change from baseline of all numeric laboratory parameters including... coagulation will be summarized using descriptive statistics
issues.generated_sap_text: Coagulation... results will be presented in data listings only.
issues.why_they_conflict: Original SAP requires descriptive summaries for coagulation; Generated SAP explicitly restricts them to listings only.
issues.description: Generated SAP removes the requirement for descriptive statistics for coagulation parameters.
issues.reasoning: Chain-of-thought: 1) Original SAP explicitly includes coagulation in the list of parameters to be summarized with descriptive statistics. 2) Generated SAP explicitly states coagulation results will be presented in data listings only. 3) These statements are mutually exclusive. 4) This is a contradiction reducing the scope of analysis.

issues.original_sap_text: Actual result and change from baseline of all numeric laboratory parameters including... numeric urinalysis... will be summarized... The results for all non-numeric urinalysis parameters... will be summarized in a shift table.
issues.generated_sap_text: Urinalysis results will be presented in data listings only.
issues.why_they_conflict: Original SAP requires descriptive summaries for numeric urinalysis and shift tables for non-numeric urinalysis; Generated SAP explicitly restricts all urinalysis to listings only.
issues.description: Generated SAP removes the requirement for descriptive statistics and shift tables for urinalysis parameters.
issues.reasoning: Chain-of-thought: 1) Original SAP explicitly requires summaries for numeric urinalysis and shift tables for non-numeric urinalysis. 2) Generated SAP explicitly states urinalysis results will be presented in data listings only. 3) These statements are mutually exclusive. 4) This is a contradiction reducing the scope of analysis.

reverse_check.explanation: Generated SAP does not mention Grade 5, so no contradiction.

reverse_check.explanation: Generated SAP does not mention clinical input grades, so no contradiction.

Actual result and change from baseline of all numeric laboratory parameters including... coagulation will be summarized

extra_information_flagged.generated_sap_text: If multiple laboratory values are collected on the same study day, the value collected closest to the scheduled assessment time will be used for by-visit summaries.
extra_information_flagged.detail: Standard data handling rule not explicit in Original SAP Section 10.2.

reasoning: The Generated SAP is largely consistent with the Original SAP regarding the core laboratory analysis (hematology and clinical chemistry). It correctly identifies the parameters, the use of local laboratories, unit standardization, and the use of CTCAE v5.0 for grading. It also correctly handles unscheduled visits and worst post-baseline values for shift tables. However, there are two clear contradictions regarding the scope of analysis for ancillary parameters: the Original SAP requires descriptive statistics for coagulation and numeric urinalysis, and shift tables for non-numeric urinalysis, whereas the Generated SAP explicitly restricts these to data listings only. Additionally, the Generated SAP omits the detailed logic for assigning data to study periods (Induction vs Maintenance) and specific grading rules (clinical input, Grade 5 exclusion). These omissions and contradictions are minor in the context of the overall safety analysis but represent a reduction in reporting scope.
summary: The Generated SAP accurately captures the primary laboratory analysis methodology but contradicts the Original SAP by restricting coagulation and urinalysis to listings only, whereas the Original SAP required summaries. It also omits detailed logic for assigning data to study periods and specific grading rules found in the Original SAP.
